items.title: Petronas FutureTech 4.0 invites startups to regional roadshows
items.summary:
- Petronas Ventures and BCG X.Ventures Southeast Asia are hosting regional events for the FutureTech 4.0 accelerator program.
- Roadshows will occur in Johor (Feb. 15), Bangkok (Feb. 20), and Singapore (Feb. 25).
- Startups will gain access to industry leaders, guidance, piloting opportunities, and corporate partnerships.

items.title: AI drives Shell’s energy transformation
items.summary:
- Shell's first global energy outlook released in two years highlights AI's potential impact on energy by 2050.
- Oil demand expected to rise by 3-5 million barrels per day until the 2030s, natural gas demand projected to grow until the 2040s.
- Three AI-driven energy scenarios outlined by Shell exceed the 1.5°C Paris Agreement limit but show progress in decarbonization and carbon removal.

items.title: SoftBank reports $2.4b loss in Q3
items.summary:
- SoftBank reported a net loss of 369 billion yen (US$2.4 billion) for Q3 2023, contrasting with a profit of 950 billion yen (US$6.2 million) during the same period last year.
- The loss was largely attributed to a 309 billion yen (US$2 billion) deficit in the Vision Fund, influenced by decreasing valuations of public holdings such as Coupang and Didi.
- SoftBank is pursuing a US$500 billion AI initiative named Stargate in collaboration with OpenAI, aiming to strengthen AI infrastructure despite the volatility of the Vision Fund.

items.title: [Shein](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=shein), Temu sales dip after Trump’s trade move
items.summary:
- Shein and [Temu](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=temu) experience significant sales drops due to potential new US trade policies.
- Shein’s US sales declined by 16% to 41% from February 5 to February 9, while Temu's sales decreased by up to 32%.
- The proposed policy to end duty exemptions for small imports could affect consumer spending, despite the delay in implementation.
- Shein is encouraging suppliers to move production to Vietnam to mitigate impacts, and Temu is using a 'half-custody' model to adjust supply chain operations.

items.title: Should Temasek reel in startup bets?
items.summary:
- Temasek and other state-linked funds under scrutiny after eFishery fraud allegations.
- Due diligence emphasized for state-linked investors due to public money involvement.
- History of failed investments raises questions about the responsibility of such funds.
- A fund-of-funds strategy suggested as a safer investment approach for state-linked investors.

items.title: Ant International opens first Middle East office in Saudi
items.summary:
- Ant International, a digital payment provider, opens its first Middle East office in Saudi Arabia.
- The office aims to enhance collaboration with local payment partners, focusing on small and medium-sized enterprises.
- The company plans to launch its payment solution, Antom, later this year, facilitating payments in over 100 currencies.

items.title: 20 largest exits in India
items.summary:
- India has witnessed numerous mergers and acquisitions (M&A) over the years, including both blockbuster and less notable deals.
- Data on M&A transactions in India is scarce, prompting the creation of this focused overview.
- M&A transactions can vary in structure, including all-stock, cash, or a combination, meaning high values do not guarantee good shareholder returns.
- The dataset may have limitations and the authors welcome feedback for corrections or missing information at research@techinasia.com.

items.title: Global EV sales rise 18% in January as Europe leads
items.summary:
- Global sales of electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by 18% year-on-year in January 2025, totaling 1.3 million units.
- Europe and North America experienced the fastest growth, outpacing China for the first time since February 2024.
- In Europe, EV sales increased by 21% to 250,000 units, influenced by new CO2 emission targets from the EU.
- The United States and Canada saw a 22.1% increase in EV sales, reaching 130,000 units.
- Global regions, in general, reported a 50% increase in sales year-on-year.
- China's sales reached 700,000 units, an 11.8% increase from the previous year, but down 43% from December due to the Chinese New Year holiday.

items.title: [Foxconn](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=foxconn) seeks Nissan partnership in EVs
items.summary:
- Foxconn aims to establish a cooperative relationship with [Nissan](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=nissan) rather than acquiring the company.
- Chairman Young Liu stated, 'Purchasing its shares is not our aim; our aim is cooperation.'
- Liu mentioned that acquiring a stake in Nissan could be considered if it facilitates collaboration.

items.title: [Orbit Startups](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=orbit_startups) raises $60m to support entrepreneurs
items.summary:
- Orbit Startups has successfully raised $60 million to aid entrepreneurs.
- The funding aims to support startup growth and innovation.
- This investment will particularly focus on areas that have been underfunded in the past.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI scientist’s firm expands to Tel Aviv, eyes $20b
items.author: Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Levy, Daniel Gross
items.summary:
- Safe Superintelligence (SSI) is an AI startup co-founded by former OpenAI chief scientist Ilya Sutskever.
- The company is expanding in Tel Aviv and relocating to Midtown, adding to its Silicon Valley presence.
- Founded in May 2024, SSI has raised US$1 billion at a US$5 billion valuation from investors like Sequoia Capital and Andreessen Horowitz.
- SSI is reportedly seeking additional funding to potentially raise its valuation to US$20 billion.
- The firm aims to develop advanced AI models that surpass human intelligence while aligning with human interests, although specific technologies or products have not been disclosed.

items.title: US chip toolmaker Lam Research to invest $1.2b in India
items.summary:
- Lam Research plans to invest over 100 billion rupees (approximately US$1.2 billion) in Karnataka, India.
- The investment was announced during the ‘Invest Karnataka’ event on Feb. 12.
- The Karnataka government is promoting the sector expansion with a US$10 billion incentive package.
- India’s semiconductor market is projected to reach a valuation of US$63 billion by 2026.

items.title: Binance, US SEC request 60-day pause in legal battle
items.summary:
- Binance and the US SEC requested a 60-day pause in their legal case due to a new cryptocurrency task force.
- The SEC filed a lawsuit against Binance for trading volume inflation and fund mismanagement in June 2023.
- The newly launched SEC crypto task force aims to address regulatory challenges and potentially help resolve the case.

items.title: Deliveroo dismisses rumors of CEO exit
items.summary:
- Deliveroo confirmed CEO Will Shu will remain in his role, dismissing speculation.
- A company spokesperson stated there are no plans for Shu to step down.
- Will Shu co-founded Deliveroo in 2013 and holds over 6% of the company, making him its third-largest shareholder.
- Recent developments include the closure of cloud kitchens in Singapore due to rising operating costs and slowing demand from restaurants.
- Other notable timelines include the IPO plans in 2021, significant funding rounds, and the introduction of contactless delivery measures during the Covid-19 pandemic.

items.title: [Alibaba](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=alibaba) shares soar 7% on AI collaboration with [Apple](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=apple)
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group shares surged over 7% following news of its collaboration with Apple for AI features in China.
- Reports indicate that both companies have submitted their AI developments for regulatory approval.
- In contrast, shares of another key AI competitor, Baidu, remained stable in Hong Kong.

items.title: Foxconn prepares US, Mexico plants for potential 25% tariffs
items.summary:
- Foxconn is preparing its manufacturing plants in the US and Mexico in anticipation of potential 25% tariffs on imports from China.
- The company is exploring ways to mitigate the impact of tariffs on its operations.
- This move reflects ongoing trade tensions and could affect the supply chain and pricing strategies.

items.title: Thomson Reuters wins first AI fair use copyright case
items.summary:
- A US judge ruled that Ross Intelligence cannot use Thomson Reuters content for its AI-based legal platform.
- This is the first fair use decision in an AI copyright case.
- Fair use is often cited by tech firms in AI training disputes, but copyright holders argue it harms their businesses.
- Thomson Reuters supported the ruling, asserting that Ross's use did not meet fair use criteria.

items.title: Dubai BNPL firm Tabby raises $160m series E
items.summary:
- Tabby raised $160 million in its series E funding round.
- The valuation of the company is now $3.3 billion.
- Funding led by Blue Pool Capital and Hassana Investment Company.
- Investment illustrates rising demand for flexible financial solutions in the MENA region.

items.title: Manufacturing startup CapGrid gets $5m series A extension
items.summary:
- CapGrid Solutions, a cloud manufacturing startup, raised US$5 million in an extended series A round led by Anicut Growth Fund.
- Other participants included Nexus Venture Partners, Axilor Ventures, and angel investors.
- Established in 2021, CapGrid specializes in manufacturing precision parts for EVs and automotive industries, utilizing an AI-driven supply chain platform.
- This funding follows a previous US$3.3 million raised through an extended series A with compulsory convertible preference shares.

items.title: Indian finance platform [Mysa](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=mysa) secures $2.8m seed funding
items.author: Arpita Kapoor, Mohit Rangaraju
items.summary:
- Mysa has launched with $2.8 million in seed funding led by [Blume Ventures](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=blume-ventures).
- Other investors include Emphasis Ventures (EMVC), Antler, Neon Fund, CIIE, and angel investors like Sriharsha Majety and Nishith Rastogi.
- Mysa targets businesses with annual revenues or expenditures between 10-300 crore rupees (approximately $11.5 million – $345 million).

items.title: Loans pop as Indonesia rates drop
items.summary:
- Indonesian banks expect increased lending growth in 2023 due to regulatory incentives.
- Bank Indonesia targets lending growth of 11% to 13%.
- Carsome Group formed a partnership with MUFG's JACCS to enhance auto financing in Malaysia, with JACCS acquiring a 49% stake in Carsome Capital.

items.title: Indonesia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Indonesia's tech startup scene is rapidly growing, producing unicorns like GoTo and Bukalapak.
- The country faces challenges in tracking which companies receive the most funding.
- An automated tracker is suggested to monitor the latest funding developments.

items.title: Chinese brain-machine firm StairMed nets $48m
items.summary:
- China-based StairMed, specializing in brain-machine interfaces, has secured $48 million in its latest funding round.
- The investment is aimed at advancing the development of its innovative technology and scaling operations.
- This funding round reflects confidence in the potential of brain-computer interface technology.

items.title: Quantum computing startup QuEra raises $230m in funding
items.summary:
- QuEra Computing secured over US$230 million in a funding round announced on Feb. 12.
- Key investors include Google’s Quantum AI and the SoftBank Vision Fund; valuation undisclosed.
- The company specializes in neutral-atom quantum computing, utilizing lasers to control uncharged atoms.
- US$60 million of the funding is contingent upon meeting specific conditions.
- Funding will support the development of fault-tolerant quantum computing technology.

items.title: AI chip startup Positron raises $23.5m
items.summary:
- Positron raised US$23.5 million to scale its AI chip production.
- Funding came from Valor Equity Partners, Atreides Management, Flume Ventures, and Resilience Reserve.
- Positron’s chips are designed for AI inference, achieving performance with less than one-third the power consumption of Nvidia’s H100.
- Analysts predict increased traction for inference chips as AI adoption expands across industries.

items.title: Google backs Toonsutra’s expansion in Indian webtoon market
items.author: Vishal Anand, Sharad Devarajan
items.summary:
- Toonsutra is an Indian webtoon platform offering localized digital content in English, Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu.
- The startup has raised $5.9 million from investors including Sony Innovation Fund and Google.
- Founded in 2023, it currently has over 500,000 monthly active users and generates revenue through in-app purchases.

items.title: EU watchdog eyes more action against [DeepSeek](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=deepseek)
items.summary:
- The European privacy watchdog may take further regulatory action against Chinese AI startup DeepSeek due to concerns about data practices.
- This follows Italy's block of DeepSeek's chatbot, citing a lack of transparency in data handling.
- National regulators from France, the Netherlands, and Belgium have initiated actions against DeepSeek.
- The [European Data Protection Board](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=gdpr) (EDPB) is expanding its AI enforcement taskforce to include DeepSeek, originally focused on OpenAI's ChatGPT.
- EDPB plans to establish a quick response team for urgent data protection issues.
- The EU has been a leader in enforcing privacy rules since the introduction of GDPR in 2018.

items.title: Case study: How Tech in Asia’s SYNC lives up to its name
items.summary:
- SYNC is a closed-door, invite-only event series by [Tech in Asia](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=techinasia), bringing together 100 experts in the tech and startup field.
- SYNC 2022 took place in Bali to reconnect industry players post-pandemic and included diverse activities, including yoga and HIIT sessions.
- Objective of SYNC 2022: Brand positioning for AppWorks and generating leads through meaningful connections.
- SYNC 2023 emphasized sustainability and [climate tech](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=climatetech), featuring industry leaders with East Ventures as a champion sponsor.
- Objective of SYNC 2023: Establishing East Ventures’ thought leadership in sustainable technologies.
- SYNC 2024 focused on AI, held in collaboration with the Economic Development Board of Singapore, aimed at fostering discussions among AI stakeholders.

items.title: Atome secures $80m credit facility from BlackRock, InnoVen
items.summary:
- Atome Financial has secured an $80 million credit facility involving BlackRock and InnoVen Capital.
- The funding will enhance Atome's product offerings and strengthen its operations in Southeast Asia, particularly in Singapore, Malaysia, the Philippines, and Indonesia.
- This capital boost follows a previous $200 million syndicated credit facility announced in November 2024.

items.title: AWS opens Asia-Pacific headquarters in Singapore
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) has opened its Asia-Pacific headquarters in Singapore, located at IOI Central Boulevard Towers.
- The new office spans 360,000 square feet over eight floors, accommodating up to 3,000 employees.
- This expansion follows AWS's announcement of a S$12 billion (US$8.8 billion) investment in Singapore's cloud infrastructure from 2024 to 2028, expected to contribute S$23.7 billion (US$17.5 billion) to GDP and create 12,300 jobs annually.
- The office includes AWS's first flagship executive briefing center in Asia, with an innovation hub set to launch later this year.

items.title: Paris summit AI declaration sparks UK, US criticism
items.summary:
- Nations at the Paris summit agreed on AI sustainability and cybersecurity, but the US and UK did not support the declaration.
- A communique was signed by France, China, India, and Canada, emphasizing ethical and sustainable AI development.
- UK spokesperson criticized the declaration for lacking focus on global governance and national security.
- US Vice President JD Vance warned against Europe’s regulatory stance and excessive restrictions.
- Campaign groups expressed concerns that the UK’s decision could damage its reputation in AI safety and ethics.

items.title: Temu sellers use fake labels, costing US postal service
items.summary:
- Temu sellers are using fake labels for shipping, leading to significant losses for the US Postal Service.
- The fraudulent activity has raised concerns regarding the integrity of shipment tracking.
- Investigations are underway to address the misuse of labels and its impacts on logistics.

items.title: Apple said to choose Alibaba over DeepSeek for China AI
items.summary:
- Apple is partnering with Alibaba to introduce its Apple Intelligence platform in China.
- The company considered DeepSeek and ByteDance but opted for Alibaba due to challenges with localizing with Baidu.
- The Apple Intelligence platform has not launched in China, a crucial market that recently saw an 11% decline in iPhone sales because of its absence.

items.title: SMIC profits fall 38.4% as revenue rises
items.summary:
- Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC) reported a 38.4% decline in Q4 2024 profit.
- Net profit for the period was US$107.6 million, below the expected US$193.45 million.
- Revenue rose by 31.5% to US$2.2 billion, exceeding predictions of US$2.18 billion.
- Advanced manufacturing contributes minimally to SMIC's revenue.

items.title: OpenAI board yet received Musk’s takeover bid, source says
items.summary:
- OpenAI’s board has not received a formal takeover bid from Elon Musk’s consortium as of February 11.
- Musk announced a US$97.4 billion offer to acquire OpenAI, but CEO Sam Altman dismissed it as a disruptive tactic.
- Altman affirmed that OpenAI is not for sale and the board intends to reject the bid to maintain its mission.

items.title: Klook lands $100m to expand in Asia Pacific
items.summary:
- Klook, a travel experiences platform, has raised $100 million from Vitruvian Partners.
- The funding aims to enhance its operations in the Asia Pacific and globally.
- Investment will improve customer service, merchant support, and efficiency, in collaboration with Google Cloud on AI.
- This is part of a series of funding rounds, following $210 million raised in a Series E+ round in 2023.

items.title: Temu overhauls supply chain over US tariffs
items.summary:
- Temu is modifying its supply chain strategy due to new tariffs from the Trump administration.
- The company is shifting to a "half-custody" model for vendor-managed shipping to US warehouses.
- This change may lead to higher prices on Temu as shipping costs increase and logistical efficiencies decline.
- Temu and competitor Shein may face changes to the US "de minimis" rule affecting low-value imports.
- Recent developments include Temu's plans for Korean market entry and shifts to US-stored products after tariff exemptions end.

items.title: Archer Aviation secures $300m in BlackRock-backed funding
items.summary:
- Archer Aviation has secured $300 million in equity funding for its electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft development.
- The funding round included contributions from BlackRock and Wellington, increasing total funding to $3.36 billion.
- The funds will support collaboration with Anduril for a hybrid VTOL aircraft under the Archer Defense program.
- Archer is also working on launching its commercial air taxi service and aims to produce 650 aircraft per year by 2030 at its Georgia facility.

items.title: Web3 development studio Mirai Labs raises $4m in funding
items.summary:
- Web3 development studio Mirai Labs has successfully raised $4 million in funding.
- The funding round was aimed at enhancing its technology and expanding its team.
- Mirai Labs is focused on developing decentralized applications and services.

items.title: Microsoft boosts clean energy with 389 MW solar deal
items.summary:
- Microsoft has entered a 389 MW solar energy deal to enhance its clean energy portfolio.
- The deal is part of Microsoft's commitment to sustainability and reducing carbon emissions.
- This initiative aligns with their goal to be carbon negative by 2030.
- The solar project is expected to supply energy to several of Microsoft's data centers.

items.title: Insurtech startup Comulate raises $20m series B
items.author: Jordan Katz, Michael Mattheakis
items.summary:
- Comulate has raised $20 million in a series B funding round co-led by Bond and Workday.
- The funding will be used to expand technology offerings and scale operations.
- The US-based company previously raised $5 million and has not disclosed its current valuation.
- Co-founders are CEO Jordan Katz and CTO Michael Mattheakis.
- In 2024, Comulate tripled its revenue to the tens of millions and attracted large firms.
- The company shifted focus from SaaS tools to insurance to address industry inefficiencies.

items.title: Australian ecommerce startup secures $800k pre-seed funding
items.author: Nate Spiteri, Drew Flaherty
items.summary:
- Shopfront, a Melbourne-based startup, has raised US$800,000 in pre-seed funding.
- Investors include Antler, Co-Ventures, 5H Values Capital, and angel syndicates.
- Founded in April 2024 by CEO Nate Spiteri and CTO Drew Flaherty, Shopfront utilizes AI to streamline ecommerce sales.
- The funding will allow the expansion of the team to four members and will support software and marketing initiatives.
- Currently testing its first paid pilot before a public launch planned for Q2 2025, focusing on rapid customer onboarding.

items.title: [Una Brands](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=ecommerce) confronts slowing growth, even as tariff clouds loom
items.author: Kiren Tanna, Kushal Patel, Tobias Heusch
items.summary:
- Una Brands, a Singapore-based ecommerce roll-up firm, reported a 4.8% revenue growth in 2023, but its loss before taxes rose by 4.2%.
- The company, established in 2017, focuses on acquiring established brands generating between $300,000 and $20 million annually.
- The firm experienced a significant slowdown from a 9x growth between 2021 and 2022 to its recent performance, citing a shift towards [profitability](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=business growth) and sustainable growth.

items.title: Israeli AI startup Voyantis raises $41m led by Intel Capital
items.author: Ido Wiesenberg, Eran Friendinger
items.summary:
- Voyantis, an Israeli AI startup, raised US$41 million led by Intel Capital.
- Total funding now stands at US$60 million.
- Founded in 2020, Voyantis focuses on optimizing customer acquisition and retention.
- The new funding will accelerate growth and enhance platform capabilities, along with expanding marketing efforts.

items.title: [South Korea](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=southkorea)’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article provides insights into [South Korea’s startup funding](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=startupfunding) landscape through charts and data.
- It includes two main sections: a weekly update featuring recent investors and companies, and macro trends analyzing the distribution of funding across various sectors.
- Highlights the need for a subscription to access premium content, including charts and visuals.

items.title: [Swiggy](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=swiggy) adds 2% fee on restaurant orders
items.summary:
- Swiggy will implement a 2% collection fee on all [restaurant orders](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=restaurant) starting on February 16.
- The fee will be deducted from restaurant payouts and is intended to facilitate customer payments.
- Some restaurant operators have raised concerns about the fee.
- Swiggy has invited select restaurants to provide feedback regarding the new fee.

items.title: Intel taps Israeli executive as interim data center chief
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Karin Eibschitz Segal appointed as interim head of Intel's Data Center and AI Group after Justin Hotard's departure, who becomes Nokia’s CEO on April 1.
- Eibschitz Segal has over 20 years at Intel, with senior roles in design engineering and validation.
- The appointment comes as Intel shifts strategy to expand manufacturing for external clients.

items.title: Australian healthtech startup nets $112m series C
items.author: Dr. Aengus Tran, Dimitry Tran
items.summary:
- Harrison.ai, a Sydney-based startup, raised AU$179 million (US$112 million) in a series C funding round.
- The funding will facilitate global expansion into the US, Europe, EMEA, and Asia Pacific.
- The round was co-led by Aware Super, ECP Asset Management, and Horizons Ventures, with new investors including the National Reconstruction Fund and Wollemi Capital Group.
- Established in 2018 by brothers Dr. Aengus Tran and Dimitry Tran, the startup specializes in AI tools for medical diagnostics in radiology and pathology.

items.title: YouTube expands AI tools with auto-dubbing, age ID
items.summary:
- YouTube announces new AI initiatives for 2025, with CEO Neal Mohan highlighting its importance.
- Expansion of auto-dubbing feature to all Partner Program members to aid in video translation.
- Enhancement of Content ID system to detect unauthorized AI-generated content.
- Introduction of machine learning technology for estimating user ages for recommendations.
- Previous AI tools for creators include video idea generation, thumbnail creation, and music addition for shorts.
- YouTube aims to strengthen its cultural influence and expand its presence on TV as a primary viewing medium in the US.

items.title: Dubai customer engagement firm Merit raises $28m series B
items.summary:
- Merit has raised $28 million in a series B funding round.
- The funding was led by Alistithmar Capital and Tech Invest Com, with participation from Endeavor Catalyst, Salica Investments, and Stride Ventures.
- Funds will be used to expand in Saudi Arabia, UAE, and Egypt, and to enhance technology and product offerings, including an "Agent as a Service" model utilizing AI tools.
